data.title: High Speed Trains from Guilin to Kunming
meta_keywords: High Speed Train from Guilin to Kunming
Bullet Train from Kunming to Guilin
data.meta_description: Take a Kunming Guilin High Speed Train via Guiyang to visit Stone Forest, Huangguoshu Waterfall, Yangshuo, Li River, etc. Check the railway route, schedules, stations, and highlights.
data.text:
Kunming Guilin High Speed Train

Kunming Guilin high speed train running between Kunming city in Yunnan Province and Guilin city in Guangxi Province has been providing a lot of convenience and cutting down the transferring time between both favored tourist cities that is about 740 kilometers away in China. At present, you could take the G-train for only about 4.5 hours to get to Kunming from Guilin or get to Guilin from Kunming, and the G trains would pass Qujing (曲靖), Anshun (安顺), Guiyang (贵阳), Sanjiang (三江), and other hot tourist destination with fine sightseeing. Besides, if you take the D-train, it needs about 7.5-8 hours to cover the whole railway of about 1,088km long and you can go by Shilin (石林), Puzhehei (普者黑), Guangnan (广南), Baise (百色), Nanning (南宁), Liuzhou (柳州), and other places in Yunnan and Guangxi provinces. As the availability of Kunming Guilin High Speed Train, which offer a fantastic chance to travel with speed and beauty on the way, you are highly recommended to get on the bullet train and enjoy all the natural splendors in those great beautiful places in the southern part in China. Let’s board!

Kunming Guilin High Speed Train Schedules

● Kunming to Guilin

>> 3 Days Kunming Spring City Tour

>> 3 Days Classic Guilin Tour - Guilin Brief Vacation

Other Recommended Section on Kunming Guilin High Speed Railway

Whether you take a G train or a D train between Kunming and Guilin, you can expect more than the highlights in Kunming and Guilin and the high speed train experience. As there are some interesting tourist cities along the way, you are recommended to get off at those places to savor their great attractions and charm to catch more beauty of China! Please check the train schedule of each recommended popular railway section between Kunming and Guilin.

From - To Frequency (day) Operating Hours Duration Kunming to AnshunOver 20About 07:00-21:00About 2 hours Kunming to GuiyangAbout 40About 07:00-21:00About 2-2.5 hours Kunming to PuzheheiOver 20About 07:30-19:00About 1.5 hours Guilin to PuzheheiAbout 5About 07:00-09:30About 5.5-6 hours Guilin to GuiyangOver 40About 08:00-21:00About 2-3 hours Guilin to AnshunAbout 3About 08:00-18:30About 3 hours

Please Note: This information of time and duration might changes slightly, be free to contact us for the up-to-date schedule.

What to See along Kunming Guilin High Speed Railway

Taking a Kunming Guilin high speed train, no matter from which direction, you would have a series of natural highlights to enjoy and marvel at the pretty landscape of southern China. Let’s see what to see in the hot destinations like Kunming, Anshun, Guiyang, Guilin, etc.

Guiyang

Guiyang city is the capital of Guizhou Province, and it has many featured scenic area for you to savor the natural landscape, ethnic culture, etc. Besides the top popular Qingyan Ancient Town of very antique and pure characteristic, you are also recommended to spend some relaxing time in the Qianling Park, Huaxi Scenic Resort, and other beautiful places in Guiyang.

Useful links:

Popular Guiyang Tour Packages | Top Guiyang Things to Do

Recommended Tours:

>> 2 Days Guiyang Qingyan Ancient Town Tour

>> 6 Days Diverse Guizhou Tour (Guiyang-Fanjingshan-Kaili)

Guiyang North Railway Stations

Location: East side of Jiaxiu North Road, Guanshanhu District, Guiyang (贵阳市观山湖区甲秀北路东侧 - 贵阳北站); about 40mins for 15km to the downtown.

Transportation: This station is not very far from city center. From there, transferring by local taxi is very convenient and recommended for tourist from other countries. It needs about 40 minutes to Jiaxiu Tower and city center, about 25 minutes to drive to Qianling Park, about 40 minutes to Huaxi Scenic Resort, about 50 minutes to Qingyan Ancient Town, etc.

Tips for Booking and Taking Kunming Guilin High Speed Train

1. Seats choosing & price comparing

On Kunming Guilin high speed G trains, there are three types of seats: the “Business Class Seats” like the first class seat in an aircraft and the most comfortable and expensive, with the price of 1155.0RMB per person, the “First Class Seats” of the middle class of 613.0-616.0.0RMB per person and the “Second Class Seats” of the most economical class of 371.5-373.5RMB per person. On Kunming Guilin high speed D trains, two types of seats are offered: the “First Class Seats” with better experience of 625.0-641.5RMB per person and the economical “Second Class Seats” of 391.0-401.5RMB per person. Prices are slightly different during tourist peak season and off season.

>> Check more about types of seat on high speed trains.

2. Booking & collect your bullet train ticket

To book a Kunming Guilin high speed train ticket, you could choose to book it at the official website: China Railway Customer Service Center or with a travel agency, also you could directly tell China Discovery to book the tickets for you. Besides, you could go to the Railway Station or Designated Ticket Offices to do that.

To collect your high speed train ticket, you could go to the railway station nearby, however, the Self-service Ticketing Machines are not serving foreign people. Besides, you can tell China Discovery to help you to do the collection, which only needs your passport information.

>> Check more about booking and collecting high speed train tickets.

3. How to embark the bullet train?

1) Prepare your documents well (valid passport with China Visa); 2) Get to the right train station in advance; 3) Collect train tickets; 4) Read your train ticket; 5) Pass the security control; 6) Pass through Security & Luggage Checks; 7) Find the right waiting room; 8) Cross the ticket checking gate; 9) Get to the right platform; 10) Get on your train. Keep the ticket well, because the ticket will be checked again to leave the station after you get off.

>> Check more about boarding on & getting off a high speed train.

4. Facilities and service

All high speed trains in China are equipped with advanced facilities and good service to make your journey more convenient and comfortable. There are different places you can put your luggage onboard, racks and specialized luggage storage areas. Besides, the air-conditioner train offers you plug under the seats to charge your phone or laptop, sightseeing window to view the outside scenery as well as western-style toilets. There is also available dining area you can get some supplies. Bilingual signs and the broadcast use both Chinese and English so that you don’t need to worry about the communication.

>> Check more about facilities & service on high speed train.

High Speed Train Travel with China Discovery
